meanings.definition: A young bird that has recently hatched.
meanings.sent1: The hatcheling chirped softly in the nest.
meanings.sent2: The mother bird fed the hatcheling worms.
meanings.sent3: The hatcheling tried to fly but only managed a short hop.
meanings.sent4: The hatcheling's downy feathers were like a fluffy cloud.
meanings.sent5: Children gathered around to see the adorable hatcheling up close.

meanings.definition: To emerge from an egg as a young bird.
meanings.sent1: The egg cracked open, and the chick hatcheling emerged.
meanings.sent2: The robin hatcheling pecked its way out of the shell.
meanings.sent3: The hatcheling popped out of the eggshell like a surprise.
meanings.sent4: The hatcheling burst forth into the world with a chirp of joy.
meanings.sent5: The hatcheling's first moments of freedom were filled with wonder.

meanings.definition: To bring forth or produce young birds from eggs.
meanings.sent1: The hen hatcheling her chicks was a heartwarming sight.
meanings.sent2: The duck hatcheling her ducklings in the pond.
meanings.sent3: The farmer watched the hen hatcheling with pride.
meanings.sent4: The nest was a cradle of life, hatcheling new birds into the world.
meanings.sent5: The mother bird was busy hatcheling her brood in the spring.
